citeinfo.origin: Minnesota Department of Natural Resources (DNR) - Ecological and Water Resources
citeinfo.title: DNR Hydrography - Listed Infested Waters

descript.abstract:
These are water bodies (lakes, streams/rivers, wetlands) listed as infested with any of these aquatic invasive species:
  • bighead carp
  • round goby
  • Brazilian waterweed
  • ruffe
  • brittle naiad
  • silver carp
  • Eurasian watermilfoil
  • spiny waterflea
  • faucet snail
  • starry stonewort
  • flowering rush
  • viral hemorrhagic septicemia (VHS)
  • grass carp
  • white perch
  • New Zealand mud snail
  • zebra mussel
    • The DNR will add a lake, river, pond or wetland to the infested waters list if it contains an aquatic invasive species that could spread to other waters. The DNR may also list a lake, river, pond or wetland as infested if it is connected to a body of water where an aquatic invasive species is present. The list on the DNR website, not this GIS layer, is the official record of the infested waters list for MN. For more information, see the official infested waters list at: http://www.dnr.state.mn.us/invasives/ais/infested.html NOTE: As of Dec. 2015, this layer is ~ 98% complete. Several rivers, streams, and creeks are missing from this layer. Lake Superior tributaries are not displayed correctly.
descript.purpose: To provide a comprehensive, statewide layer to identify Minnesota's designated infested waters to meet DNR business needs, including mapping, analysis, reporting, statuatory responsibilities, etc. Usage Tips: In Quick Layers, there are separate Lake and Stream layers for each species. Individual species layers should be drawn independently (with no other species layer turned on) so that one layer doesn't obscure another. To show more than one species at a time, adjust the line widths of the layers, putting layers with narrow width symbols on top of those with wider symbols. To show all designated waters at one time, use the Designated Infested Streams (all) and Designated Infested Waterbodies (all) layers. Use the Identify Tool to click on a feature and get a list of all invasive species within the selected waterbody. Waterbodies marked with * have additional information regarding their infested status; see INV_NOTES in attribute table for more details.

timeperd.current:
Time Period of Content date indicates the date which the user can be confident of accuracy and completeness of the dataset. It should be noted this database is continuously a work in progress, and the list is updated as needed to reflect the most current conditions of the waterbodies in the state of Minnesota.
Re-delineations and edits (to the waterbody delineations) are frequent and occur as needed. See the attributes DELINEATION_DATE and DELINEATION_SRC for date and source of each polygon.

theme.themekey: AIS, Hydrography, Water, Lakes, Wetlands, inlandWaters, streams, rivers, ponds, infested waters, invasive species

citeinfo.title: Features derived from: DNR Hydrography - Lakes and Open Water DNR Hydrography - Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures Species data comes from a database maintained by the Invasive Species program (DNR Ecological and Water Resources Division)

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is based originally on the 100K USGS source quadrangles. Polygons for managed waters have been improved by on-screen digitizing using DOQs and FSA imagery.

procstep.procdesc: The lake polygons are derived from DNR Hydrography - All Water Features. Stream features are derived from Streams with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures.

enttyp.enttypd: Stream Routes with Kittle Numbers and Mile Measures

attr.attrdef: Unique GIS record number for each stream route feature in DNR Hydrography SDE - Stream Route Centerlines (GIS-calculated.)

Unique Fisheries Watercourse ID for joining/linking stream routes to DNR Fisheries Stream Survey Oracle DB. FW_IDs are assigned based on how the watercourse is managed by DNR Fisheries (an FW_ID may correspond to an entire stream or portion of a stream.) Dummy (invalid) Kittle Numbers have FW_ID = 0.

Watercourse ID per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database. A valid KITTLE_NBR has a drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' (See VALID = Y, below). A dummy KITTLE_NBR has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' (See VALID = N, below).
Stream Name per DNR Fisheries Stream Survey database
Length of entire stream route in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for starting (downstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Mile measure for ending (upstream) location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Length of linear feature in miles. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for starting location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM X coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
UTM Y coordinate for ending location of linear feature. (GIS-calculated.)
Flag to identify validity of assigned Kittle Numbers

edom.edomvd: Dummy (invalid) Kittle Number assigned by DNR Fisheries; has the format 'MAJXXXX-xxxxx' where MAJXXXX represents the 4-digit code for the HUC04 drainage and -xxxxx is a unique, sequential number. Dummy Kittle Numbers usually pertain to small unmanaged streams and streams outside of MN.

Valid Kittle Number assigned by DNR Fisheries; has a valid drainage-branching format 'X-000-000-000...' where X identifies the major drainage (H-Hudson Bay, I-Iowa/Cedar River, M-Mississippi River, S-Lake Superior) and '-000-000-000...' is a branching identifier that lengthens as you move upstream. Valid Kittle Numbers usually pertain to major streams and/or streams that have had some type of DNR management.

attr.attrdef: A concatenation of Kittle Name + (Kittle Number) for labeling purposes
Date the GIS layer was published or updated and re-published.
